thread.title: Summertown set for another state tourney
thread.title_full: Summertown set for another state tourney

title: Summertown set for another state tourney
text:
Summertown set for another state tourney Summertown set for another state tourney 
Members of the District 12-A and Region 6-A championship Summertown girls volleyball team are from left, front row, Brooklyn Gable, Madison Dinwiddie, McKenzie Kilburn, Maria Kersteins, Maggie Long and Anna Kate Collier. (Second row) Meg Dinwiddie, Rachel Barker, Sara Beasley, Josie Franks, Haley Brown, Lexie Johnson, Kaylee Johnson, Anna Kate Bacon and manager Bex Barker. The team's coach is Andrea Kelly. (Courtesy photo) From Staff Reports 
Summertown’s volleyball history of success goes back to the early years of the sport which is now in its fifth decades of sponsorship by the TSSAA. 
The 2015 Lady Eagles team has kept their District 12-A and Region 6-A championship tradition alive and are set for yet another year in the State Tournament at Murfreesboro. 
Summertown, coached by Andrea Kelly, carries a 36-7 record into a 2 p.m. match against Trinity Christian (19-13) of Jackson. Blackman High School is the site for Wednesday’s game. 
A victory would move Summertown into a 5 p.m. clash on Wednesday against the winner of South Greene (43-2) and Goodpasture (40-10). If Summertown loses to Trinity, they would play again at 8 p.m. Wednesday against the loser of South Greene and Goodpasture. 
The match-ups for the opposite bracket first round are Middleton (21-7) versus Concord Christian (35-13) and Jackson County against Eagleville (28-14). 
The double-elimination tourney continues Thursday at 10 a.m. at Murphy Center on the Middle Tennessee State University campus. The championship round for all divisions are at Murphy Center. 
Williamson County is well-represented in the state tourney with Page in Class AA and Franklin and defending champ Brentwood in Class AAA. 
On Wednesday, Page(31-20) plays Jackson Southside (34-10) at 11 a.m. at Siegel High School. Franklin (29-11) meets Knox Bearden at 9:30 a.m. at Blackman while Brentwood (48-3) goes against Ooltewah (45-11) at 12:30 p.m. at MTSU. 
The two schools who dealt Zion Christian Academy will begin their state title hunt on Wedneday at Siegel. Knoxville Webb (50-4) meets St. George’s (22-9) at 9:30 a.m. and St. Mary’s (23-6) duels Harding Academy (20-3) at 11 a.m.
